topics.name: Overview
topics.about: The Ownership Token Index is an MVP dashboard for evaluating the credibility and worthiness of token ownership across protocols.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the Ownership Token Index?
questions.answer: To establish whether holding a token provides meaningful ownership rights in a protocol, or if the claim is mostly speculative. We use a standardized framework so results are comparable across projects.

questions.question: Who is this for?
questions.answer: Crypto investors, governance participants, analysts, and researchers who want an objective view of token ownership quality.

topics.name: Submission
topics.about: How tokens are proposed, reviewed, and added to the index.

questions.question: How do I submit a token for analysis?
questions.answer: Use the submit flow to share a token, its contract address, and a short description of why it matters. We review each submission for completeness and scope before adding it to the index.

questions.question: What happens after I submit?
questions.answer: We confirm the details, perform an initial review using the framework, and publish a write-up once the evidence is verified. You will hear from us when it is ready.

questions.question: Where does the submission go internally?
questions.answer: Submissions are logged for the team to triage and track. That keeps the workflow consistent while we gather sources and prepare the analysis.
